page.title: 13MEMORIES
page.content: V.E.DAY 1945 - People decorated houses, red, white, & blue. Many streets had parties. Everybody contributed something.Tables & benches were set out in the streets. Afterwards there was singing and dancing and some streets had a great bonfire. One lady said the bonfire reminded her of the times she had stood on 'The Hollins' and watched Manchester burning. Schools had parties and St. Paul's chose a Victory Queen. CORONATION 1953 - Many people crammed into houses which had a TV. Houses decorated. Parties at school. St. Peter's had a fun day on the King George Playing Field - all children were given a Macclesfield Silk Handkerchief. Silver Jubilee 1977 - More 'Street' parties in the War Memorial Hall.
